channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: AT&T will launch a 'digital learning platform' with WarnerMedia content
item.description: AT&T says it's planning to launch a connected learning platform with WarnerMedia.

item.title: Google Assistant can fill out your payment info for your next takeout order
item.description: Google's Assistant updates for Spring 2021 revolve around simplifying the restaurant checkout process and making it easier to automate your smart home.

item.title: Watch Nintendo's latest Indie World Showcase here at noon ET
item.description: Expect around 20 minutes of indie games that are coming to Switch.

item.title: Ford's BlueCruise self-driving tech did a 110,000-mile road trip
item.description: Ford has been testing its BlueCruise hands-free highway driving with a 110,000-mile road trip.

item.title: United Airlines unveils plan to fund more sustainable jet fuel made from trash
item.description: (Reuters) -United Airlines said on Tuesday it has partnered with global firms including Nike Inc and Siemens AG in an "Eco-Skies Alliance" to finance use this year of about 3.4 million gallons of low-carbon, sustainable aviation fuel derived from trash. Though tiny compared with the 4.3 billion gallons of jet fuel that United consumed in 2019 prior to the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the amount triples the roughly 1 million gallons of sustainable fuel it has used each year since 2016. Airlines have used sustainable fuel since 2008 as part of efforts to reduce outright emissions, but so far this represents barely 1 percent of the fuel used worldwide, industry groups say.

item.title: Instagram is still trying to figure out the best way to hide likes
item.description: Instagram is testing a new way to hide likes in its first major update to the long-running experiment.

item.title: TCL reveals three new affordable ‘20’ series smartphones
item.description: The cheap phone announcements have been coming hard and fast this month: first, there was Samsung’s slew of Galaxy A devices, then HMD’s revamped line of Nokia phones, and now TCL is expanding its line of 20-series smartphones with a few new models.

item.title: TCL’s latest concept phone combines a folding screen with a rollable one
item.description: TCL revealed more than just a handful of budget phones today — it also pulled back the curtain on yet another wild concept device that we’ll probably never get to buy. It’s called the Fold n’ Roll, and really, the name says it all.

item.title: Get access to expert taught classes from Alexi Ohanian, Scott Kelly and more with Knowable
item.description: Knowable is an all-audio eLearning provider that gives daily lessons on topics ranging from productivity to self-care. Over 30,000 users are spending every day learning from astronauts, tech legends and celebrities without ever using a screen.

item.title: Parallels Desktop on M1 Macs now runs ARM Windows 10 at 'native speeds'
item.description: Parallels Desktop 16.5 has arrived with native support for M1 Macs, promising Windows 10 virtual machines at 'native speeds' — if you don't mind the ARM version.

item.title: Sony A1 review: The alpha of mirrorless cameras
item.description: After Canon released the R5 with 8K and fast shooting speeds, Sony is counter-punching with its new flagship, the 8K, 50-megapixel A1.

item.title: An Australian company helped the FBI unlock San Bernardino shooter's iPhone
item.description: The FBI tapped an Australian company to help it unlock the San Bernardino shooter's iPhone 5C.

item.title: Spotify adds more livestream platforms to its virtual event listings
item.description: Spotify began showing virtual event listings last fall, but now it's expanding that info so you can easily keep up with livestreams.

item.title: Amazon's Fire TV Stick Lite is on sale for $20 for Prime members
item.description: Amazon knocks the price of the Fire TV Stick Lite streaming dongle down to $20 for Prime members.

item.title: Apple begins studying whether the Watch can predict COVID-19
item.description: Apple has launched a study that could determine if a Watch or iPhone can predict COVID-19 and other respiratory illnesses.

item.title: Plex's latest funding will boost its own streaming catalog while supporting others
item.description: Plex has raised $50 million in new funding as part of its bid to become a one-stop shop for all things streaming.

item.title: Amazon's redesigned Echo Buds offer improved noise cancellation for $120
item.description: Amazon's second-gen Echo Buds are cheaper, smaller and offer true active noise cancellation on top of hands-free access to Alexa.

item.title: Spotify's improved podcast charts now rank individual episodes
item.description: Spotify is giving users the chance to discover even relatively unknown podcasts by launching a "Top Episodes" ranking for its charts.

item.title: Vizio's rotating Elevate soundbar is $220 off at Wellbots
item.description: Vizio's high-end Elevate soundbar is 22 percent off at Wellbots.

item.title: Urbanista says its solar-powered headphones can basically play endlessly
item.description: The Urbanista Los Angeles ANC set can convert all light into power.

item.title: The Morning After: Both Apple and Samsung have launch events planned for April
item.description: Today’s headlines: Both Apple and Samsung announce launch events for April, the first major PS5 update will roll out starting today and Microsoft's new 'Modern' accessories include its first webcam in years.

item.title: DARPA picks Lockheed Martin and Blue Origin to build nuclear spacecraft
item.description: DARPA has picked Jeff Bezo's Blue Origin, Lockheed Martin and General Atomics to build and demonstrate a spacecraft driven by nuclear thermal propulsion.

item.title: 'Final Fantasy XIV' PS5 open beta upgrades both graphics and sound
item.description: Final Fantasy XIV is now available on the PS5 as an open beta, and Square Enix's Matt Hilton has detailed the enhancements for the new console on the PlayStation Blog.

item.title: Canon confirms a high-speed EOS R3 mirrorless camera is on the way
item.description: Canon has confirmed a rumor that it's developing the EOS R3, a "high-performance, high-speed" full-frame mirrorless camera designed for news and sports, along with three new lenses.

item.title: Sony’s new Xperia 1 III smartphone is a love letter to photography nerds
item.description: Last year’s Xperia 1 II might have been a mobile photographer’s dream come true, but it was far from perfect — it didn’t have 5G in the US, its design could feel awkward, and it focused on the camera experience over just about everything else. But in designing the new Xperia 1 III, Sony seems to have addressed, well, just about everything we didn’t like about the last one.
